bug.author: YanhaoYang
bug.summary: Trained NER models are not loadable
bug.description:
I use some trained NER models to recognise entity names in some specific domains. After upgrading to v1.8.0, I found those models could not be loaded. It is easy to reproduce the problem by add following code to the official example, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/examples/training/train_ner.py#L87>https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/examples/training/train_ner.py#L87</denchmark-link> : model_path = Path('./ner') ner2 = EntityRecognizer.load(model_path, nlp.vocab) doc = nlp.make_doc('Who is Shaka Khan?') nlp.tagger(doc) ner2(doc) for word in doc: print(word.text, word.orth, word.lower, word.tag_, word.ent_type_, word.ent_iob) This will result in following error message: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "train_ner.py", line 104, in <module> main('ner') File "train_ner.py", line 94, in main ner2 = EntityRecognizer.load(model_path, nlp.vocab) File "spacy/syntax/parser.pyx", line 149, in spacy.syntax.parser.Parser.load (spacy/syntax/parser.cpp:6845) KeyError: 'actions' </denchmark-code>
It seems ner.cfg["actions"] is not necessary for NER training, but the loading code will read it anyway. <denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 1.8.0 Platform: Linux-4.10.0-19-generic-x86_64-with-debian-8.7 Python version: 3.6.1 Installed models: en

comments.comment: Closing this and making <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1046>#1046</denchmark-link> the master issue. Work in progress for spaCy v2.0!
Anyone found a workaround to load trained NER models in spacy <2.0 ?
